description: Returns a description of the specified algorithm that is in your account.

parameters.name: AlgorithmName
parameters.description: The name of the algorithm to describe.

nested_items.name: AlgorithmName
nested_items.description: The name of the algorithm being described.

nested_items.name: AlgorithmArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the algorithm.

nested_items.name: AlgorithmDescription
nested_items.description: A brief summary about the algorithm.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp specifying when the algorithm was created.

nested_items.name: TrainingSpecification
nested_items.description: Details about training jobs run by this algorithm.

nested_items.name: TrainingImage
nested_items.description: The Amazon ECR registry path of the Docker image that contains the training algorithm.

nested_items.name: TrainingImageDigest
nested_items.description: An MD5 hash of the training algorithm that identifies the Docker image used for training.

nested_items.name: SupportedHyperParameters
nested_items.description: A list of the HyperParameterSpecification objects, that define the supported hyperparameters. This is required if the algorithm supports automatic model tuning.>

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of this hyperparameter. The name must be unique.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A brief description of the hyperparameter.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of this hyperparameter. The valid types are Integer, Continuous, Categorical, and FreeText.

nested_items.name: IntegerParameterRangeSpecification
nested_items.description: A IntegerParameterRangeSpecification object that defines the possible values for an integer hyperparameter.

nested_items.name: MinValue
nested_items.description: The minimum integer value allowed.

nested_items.name: MaxValue
nested_items.description: The maximum integer value allowed.

nested_items.name: ContinuousParameterRangeSpecification
nested_items.description: A ContinuousParameterRangeSpecification object that defines the possible values for a continuous hyperparameter.

nested_items.name: MinValue
nested_items.description: The minimum floating-point value allowed.

nested_items.name: MaxValue
nested_items.description: The maximum floating-point value allowed.

nested_items.name: CategoricalParameterRangeSpecification
nested_items.description: A CategoricalParameterRangeSpecification object that defines the possible values for a categorical hyperparameter.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: The allowed categories for the hyperparameter.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: IsTunable
nested_items.description: Indicates whether this hyperparameter is tunable in a hyperparameter tuning job.

nested_items.name: IsRequired
nested_items.description: Indicates whether this hyperparameter is required.

nested_items.name: DefaultValue
nested_items.description: The default value for this hyperparameter. If a default value is specified, a hyperparameter cannot be required.

nested_items.name: SupportedTrainingInstanceTypes
nested_items.description: A list of the instance types that this algorithm can use for training.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportsDistributedTraining
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the algorithm supports distributed training. If set to false, buyers can't request more than one instance during training.

nested_items.name: MetricDefinitions
nested_items.description: A list of MetricDefinition objects, which are used for parsing metrics generated by the algorithm.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the metric.

nested_items.name: Regex
nested_items.description: A regular expression that searches the output of a training job and gets the value of the metric. For more information about using regular expressions to define metrics, see Defining metrics and environment variables.

nested_items.name: TrainingChannels
nested_items.description: A list of ChannelSpecification objects, which specify the input sources to be used by the algorithm.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the channel.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A brief description of the channel.

nested_items.name: IsRequired
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the channel is required by the algorithm.

nested_items.name: SupportedContentTypes
nested_items.description: The supported MIME types for the data.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportedCompressionTypes
nested_items.description: The allowed compression types, if data compression is used.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportedInputModes
nested_items.description: The allowed input mode, either FILE or PIPE.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportedTuningJobObjectiveMetrics
nested_items.description: A list of the metrics that the algorithm emits that can be used as the objective metric in a hyperparameter tuning job.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Whether to minimize or maximize the objective metric.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the metric to use for the objective metric.

nested_items.name: AdditionalS3DataSource
nested_items.description: The additional data source used during the training job.

nested_items.name: S3DataType
nested_items.description: The data type of the additional data source that you specify for use in inference or training.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: The uniform resource identifier (URI) used to identify an additional data source used in inference or training.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: The type of compression used for an additional data source used in inference or training. Specify None if your additional data source is not compressed.

nested_items.name: ETag
nested_items.description: The ETag associated with S3 URI.

nested_items.name: InferenceSpecification
nested_items.description: Details about inference jobs that the algorithm runs.

nested_items.name: Containers
nested_items.description: The Amazon ECR registry path of the Docker image that contains the inference code.

nested_items.name: ContainerHostname
nested_items.description: The DNS host name for the Docker container.

nested_items.name: Image
nested_items.description: The Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR) path where inference code is stored.

nested_items.name: ImageDigest
nested_items.description: An MD5 hash of the training algorithm that identifies the Docker image used for training.

nested_items.name: ModelDataUrl
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 path where the model artifacts, which result from model training, are stored. This path must point to a single gzip compressed tar archive ( .tar.gz suffix).

nested_items.name: ModelDataSource
nested_items.description: Specifies the location of ML model data to deploy during endpoint creation.

nested_items.name: S3DataSource
nested_items.description: Specifies the S3 location of ML model data to deploy.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: Specifies the S3 path of ML model data to deploy.

nested_items.name: S3DataType
nested_items.description: Specifies the type of ML model data to deploy.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: Specifies how the ML model data is prepared.

If you choose S3Object as the value of S3DataType, then SageMaker will split the key of the S3 object referenced by S3Uri by slash (/), and use the last part as the filename of the file holding the content of the S3 object.

If you choose S3Prefix as the value of S3DataType, then for each S3 object under the key name pefix referenced by S3Uri, SageMaker will trim its key by the prefix, and use the remainder as the path (relative to /opt/ml/model) of the file holding the content of the S3 object. SageMaker will split the remainder by slash (/), using intermediate parts as directory names and the last part as filename of the file holding the content of the S3 object.
Do not use any of the following as file names or directory names:
An empty or blank string.
A string which contains null bytes.
A string longer than 255 bytes.
A single dot ( .)
A double dot ( ..)

Ambiguous file names will result in model deployment failure. For example, if your uncompressed ML model consists of two S3 objects s3://mybucket/model/weights and s3://mybucket/model/weights/part1 and you specify s3://mybucket/model/ as the value of S3Uri and S3Prefix as the value of S3DataType, then it will result in name clash between /opt/ml/model/weights (a regular file) and /opt/ml/model/weights/ (a directory).

Do not organize the model artifacts in S3 console using folders. When you create a folder in S3 console, S3 creates a 0-byte object with a key set to the folder name you provide. They key of the 0-byte object ends with a slash (/) which violates SageMaker restrictions on model artifact file names, leading to model deployment failure.

nested_items.name: ModelAccessConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies the access configuration file for the ML model. You can explicitly accept the model end-user license agreement (EULA) within the ModelAccessConfig. You are responsible for reviewing and complying with any applicable license terms and making sure they are acceptable for your use case before downloading or using a model.

nested_items.name: AcceptEula
nested_items.description: Specifies agreement to the model end-user license agreement (EULA). The AcceptEula value must be explicitly defined as True in order to accept the EULA that this model requires. You are responsible for reviewing and complying with any applicable license terms and making sure they are acceptable for your use case before downloading or using a model.

nested_items.name: HubAccessConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration information for hub access.

nested_items.name: HubContentArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the hub content for which deployment access is allowed.

nested_items.name: ManifestS3Uri
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 URI of the manifest file. The manifest file is a CSV file that stores the artifact locations.

nested_items.name: ETag
nested_items.description: The ETag associated with S3 URI.

nested_items.name: ManifestEtag
nested_items.description: The ETag associated with Manifest S3 URI.

nested_items.name: ProductId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Marketplace product ID of the model package.

nested_items.name: Environment
nested_items.description: The environment variables to set in the Docker container. Each key and value in the Environment string to string map can have length of up to 1024. We support up to 16 entries in the map.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ModelInput
nested_items.description: A structure with Model Input details.

nested_items.name: DataInputConfig
nested_items.description: The input configuration object for the model.

nested_items.name: Framework
nested_items.description: The machine learning framework of the model package container image.

nested_items.name: FrameworkVersion
nested_items.description: The framework version of the Model Package Container Image.

nested_items.name: NearestModelName
nested_items.description: The name of a pre-trained machine learning benchmarked by Amazon SageMaker Inference Recommender model that matches your model. You can find a list of benchmarked models by calling ListModelMetadata.

nested_items.name: AdditionalS3DataSource
nested_items.description: The additional data source that is used during inference in the Docker container for your model package.

nested_items.name: S3DataType
nested_items.description: The data type of the additional data source that you specify for use in inference or training.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: The uniform resource identifier (URI) used to identify an additional data source used in inference or training.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: The type of compression used for an additional data source used in inference or training. Specify None if your additional data source is not compressed.

nested_items.name: ETag
nested_items.description: The ETag associated with S3 URI.

nested_items.name: ModelDataETag
nested_items.description: The ETag associated with Model Data URL.

nested_items.name: SupportedTransformInstanceTypes
nested_items.description: A list of the instance types on which a transformation job can be run or on which an endpoint can be deployed.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportedRealtimeInferenceInstanceTypes
nested_items.description: A list of the instance types that are used to generate inferences in real-time.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportedContentTypes
nested_items.description: The supported MIME types for the input data.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportedResponseMIMETypes
nested_items.description: The supported MIME types for the output data.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ValidationSpecification
nested_items.description: Details about configurations for one or more training jobs that SageMaker runs to test the algorithm.

nested_items.name: ValidationRole
nested_items.description: The IAM roles that SageMaker uses to run the training jobs.

nested_items.name: ValidationProfiles
nested_items.description: An array of AlgorithmValidationProfile objects, each of which specifies a training job and batch transform job that SageMaker runs to validate your algorithm.

nested_items.name: ProfileName
nested_items.description: The name of the profile for the algorithm. The name must have 1 to 63 characters. Valid characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, and - (hyphen).

nested_items.name: TrainingJobDefinition
nested_items.description: The TrainingJobDefinition object that describes the training job that SageMaker runs to validate your algorithm.

nested_items.name: TrainingInputMode
nested_items.description: The training input mode that the algorithm supports. For more information about input modes, see Algorithms.

nested_items.name: HyperParameters
nested_items.description: The hyperparameters used for the training job.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InputDataConfig
nested_items.description: An array of Channel objects, each of which specifies an input source.

nested_items.name: ChannelName
nested_items.description: The name of the channel.

nested_items.name: DataSource
nested_items.description: The location of the channel data.

nested_items.name: S3DataSource
nested_items.description: The S3 location of the data source that is associated with a channel.

nested_items.name: S3DataType
nested_items.description: If you choose S3Prefix, S3Uri identifies a key name prefix. SageMaker uses all objects that match the specified key name prefix for model training.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: Depending on the value specified for the S3DataType, identifies either a key name prefix or a manifest. For example:
A key name prefix might look like this: s3://bucketname/exampleprefix/

A manifest might look like this: s3://bucketname/example.manifest A manifest is an S3 object which is a JSON file consisting of an array of elements. The first element is a prefix which is followed by one or more suffixes. SageMaker appends the suffix elements to the prefix to get a full set of S3Uri. Note that the prefix must be a valid non-empty S3Uri that precludes users from specifying a manifest whose individual S3Uri is sourced from different S3 buckets. The following code example shows a valid manifest format: [ {"prefix": "s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/"}, "relative/path/to/custdata-1", "relative/path/custdata-2", ... "relative/path/custdata-N" ] This JSON is equivalent to the following S3Uri list: s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/to/custdata-1 s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/custdata-2 ... s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/custdata-N The complete set of S3Uri in this manifest is the input data for the channel for this data source. The object that each S3Uri points to must be readable by the IAM role that SageMaker uses to perform tasks on your behalf.

nested_items.name: S3DataDistributionType
nested_items.description: If you want SageMaker to replicate the entire dataset on each ML compute instance that is launched for model training, specify FullyReplicated.

nested_items.name: AttributeNames
nested_items.description: A list of one or more attribute names to use that are found in a specified augmented manifest file.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceGroupNames
nested_items.description: A list of names of instance groups that get data from the S3 data source.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ModelAccessConfig
nested_items.description: The access configuration file to control access to the ML model. You can explicitly accept the model end-user license agreement (EULA) within the ModelAccessConfig.
If you are a Jumpstart user, see the End-user license agreements section for more details on accepting the EULA.

If you are an AutoML user, see the Optional Parameters section of Create an AutoML job to fine-tune text generation models using the API for details on How to set the EULA acceptance when fine-tuning a model using the AutoML API.

nested_items.name: HubAccessConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for a private hub model reference that points to a SageMaker JumpStart public hub model.

nested_items.name: HubContentArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of your private model hub content. This should be a ModelReference resource type that points to a SageMaker JumpStart public hub model.

nested_items.name: FileSystemDataSource
nested_items.description: The file system that is associated with a channel.

nested_items.name: FileSystemId
nested_items.description: The file system id.

nested_items.name: FileSystemAccessMode
nested_items.description: The access mode of the mount of the directory associated with the channel. A directory can be mounted either in ro (read-only) or rw (read-write) mode.

nested_items.name: FileSystemType
nested_items.description: The file system type.

nested_items.name: DirectoryPath
nested_items.description: The full path to the directory to associate with the channel.

nested_items.name: ContentType
nested_items.description: The MIME type of the data.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: If training data is compressed, the compression type. The default value is None. CompressionType is used only in Pipe input mode. In File mode, leave this field unset or set it to None.

nested_items.name: RecordWrapperType
nested_items.description: Specify RecordIO as the value when input data is in raw format but the training algorithm requires the RecordIO format. In this case, SageMaker wraps each individual S3 object in a RecordIO record. If the input data is already in RecordIO format, you don't need to set this attribute. For more information, see Create a Dataset Using RecordIO.

nested_items.name: InputMode
nested_items.description: (Optional) The input mode to use for the data channel in a training job. If you don't set a value for InputMode, SageMaker uses the value set for TrainingInputMode. Use this parameter to override the TrainingInputMode setting in a AlgorithmSpecification request when you have a channel that needs a different input mode from the training job's general setting. To download the data from Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) to the provisioned ML storage volume, and mount the directory to a Docker volume, use File input mode. To stream data directly from Amazon S3 to the container, choose Pipe input mode.

nested_items.name: ShuffleConfig
nested_items.description: A configuration for a shuffle option for input data in a channel. If you use S3Prefix for S3DataType, this shuffles the results of the S3 key prefix matches. If you use ManifestFile, the order of the S3 object references in the ManifestFile is shuffled. If you use AugmentedManifestFile, the order of the JSON lines in the AugmentedManifestFile is shuffled. The shuffling order is determined using the Seed value.

nested_items.name: Seed
nested_items.description: Determines the shuffling order in ShuffleConfig value.

nested_items.name: OutputDataConfig
nested_items.description: the path to the S3 bucket where you want to store model artifacts. SageMaker creates subfolders for the artifacts.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that SageMaker uses to encrypt the model artifacts at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption. The KmsKeyId can be any of the following formats:
// KMS Key ID "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// KMS Key Alias "alias/ExampleAlias"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key Alias "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias"

nested_items.name: S3OutputPath
nested_items.description: Identifies the S3 path where you want SageMaker to store the model artifacts. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: The model output compression type. Select None to output an uncompressed model, recommended for large model outputs. Defaults to gzip.

nested_items.name: ResourceConfig
nested_items.description: The resources, including the ML compute instances and ML storage volumes, to use for model training.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The ML compute instance type.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: The number of ML compute instances to use. For distributed training, provide a value greater than 1.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The size of the ML storage volume that you want to provision.

nested_items.name: VolumeKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key that SageMaker uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that run the training job.
// KMS Key ID "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

nested_items.name: KeepAlivePeriodInSeconds
nested_items.description: The duration of time in seconds to retain configured resources in a warm pool for subsequent training jobs.

nested_items.name: InstanceGroups
nested_items.description: The configuration of a heterogeneous cluster in JSON format.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: Specifies the instance type of the instance group.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of instances of the instance group.

nested_items.name: InstanceGroupName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the instance group.

nested_items.name: TrainingPlanArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN); of the training plan to use for this resource configuration.

nested_items.name: StoppingCondition
nested_items.description: Specifies a limit to how long a model training job can run. It also specifies how long a managed Spot training job has to complete. When the job reaches the time limit, SageMaker ends the training job. Use this API to cap model training costs.

nested_items.name: MaxRuntimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that a training or compilation job can run before it is stopped.

nested_items.name: MaxWaitTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that a managed Spot training job has to complete. It is the amount of time spent waiting for Spot capacity plus the amount of time the job can run. It must be equal to or greater than MaxRuntimeInSeconds. If the job does not complete during this time, SageMaker ends the job.

nested_items.name: MaxPendingTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that a training or compilation job can be pending before it is stopped.

nested_items.name: TransformJobDefinition
nested_items.description: The TransformJobDefinition object that describes the transform job that SageMaker runs to validate your algorithm.

nested_items.name: MaxConcurrentTransforms
nested_items.description: The maximum number of parallel requests that can be sent to each instance in a transform job. The default value is 1.

nested_items.name: MaxPayloadInMB
nested_items.description: The maximum payload size allowed, in MB. A payload is the data portion of a record (without metadata).

nested_items.name: BatchStrategy
nested_items.description: A string that determines the number of records included in a single mini-batch.

nested_items.name: Environment
nested_items.description: The environment variables to set in the Docker container. We support up to 16 key and values entries in the map.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TransformInput
nested_items.description: A description of the input source and the way the transform job consumes it.

nested_items.name: DataSource
nested_items.description: Describes the location of the channel data, which is, the S3 location of the input data that the model can consume.

nested_items.name: S3DataSource
nested_items.description: The S3 location of the data source that is associated with a channel.

nested_items.name: S3DataType
nested_items.description: If you choose S3Prefix, S3Uri identifies a key name prefix. Amazon SageMaker uses all objects with the specified key name prefix for batch transform.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: Depending on the value specified for the S3DataType, identifies either a key name prefix or a manifest. For example:
A key name prefix might look like this: s3://bucketname/exampleprefix/.

A manifest might look like this: s3://bucketname/example.manifest The manifest is an S3 object which is a JSON file with the following format: [ {"prefix": "s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/"}, "relative/path/to/custdata-1", "relative/path/custdata-2", ... "relative/path/custdata-N" ] The preceding JSON matches the following S3Uris: s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/to/custdata-1 s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/custdata-2 ... s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/custdata-N The complete set of S3Uris in this manifest constitutes the input data for the channel for this datasource. The object that each S3Uris points to must be readable by the IAM role that Amazon SageMaker uses to perform tasks on your behalf.

nested_items.name: ContentType
nested_items.description: The multipurpose internet mail extension (MIME) type of the data. Amazon SageMaker uses the MIME type with each http call to transfer data to the transform job.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: If your transform data is compressed, specify the compression type. Amazon SageMaker automatically decompresses the data for the transform job accordingly. The default value is None.

nested_items.name: SplitType
nested_items.description: The method to use to split the transform job's data files into smaller batches. Splitting is necessary when the total size of each object is too large to fit in a single request. You can also use data splitting to improve performance by processing multiple concurrent mini-batches. The default value for SplitType is None, which indicates that input data files are not split, and request payloads contain the entire contents of an input object. Set the value of this parameter to Line to split records on a newline character boundary. SplitType also supports a number of record-oriented binary data formats. Currently, the supported record formats are:
RecordIO.
TFRecord.

nested_items.name: TransformOutput
nested_items.description: Identifies the Amazon S3 location where you want Amazon SageMaker to save the results from the transform job.

nested_items.name: S3OutputPath
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 path where you want Amazon SageMaker to store the results of the transform job. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

nested_items.name: Accept
nested_items.description: The MIME type used to specify the output data. Amazon SageMaker uses the MIME type with each http call to transfer data from the transform job.

nested_items.name: AssembleWith
nested_items.description: Defines how to assemble the results of the transform job as a single S3 object. Choose a format that is most convenient to you. To concatenate the results in binary format, specify None. To add a newline character at the end of every transformed record, specify Line.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt the model artifacts at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption. The KmsKeyId can be any of the following formats:
Key ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab.
Alias name: alias/ExampleAlias.
Alias name ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias.

nested_items.name: TransformResources
nested_items.description: Identifies the ML compute instances for the transform job.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The ML compute instance type for the transform job. If you are using built-in algorithms to transform moderately sized datasets, we recommend using ml.m4.xlarge or ``ml.m5.large``instance types.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: The number of ML compute instances to use in the transform job. The default value is 1, and the maximum is 100. For distributed transform jobs, specify a value greater than 1.

nested_items.name: VolumeKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt model data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that run the batch transform job.
Key ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab.
Alias name: alias/ExampleAlias.
Alias name ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias.

nested_items.name: TransformAmiVersion
nested_items.description: Specifies an option from a collection of preconfigured Amazon Machine Image (AMI) images. Each image is configured by Amazon Web Services with a set of software and driver versions.
Accelerator: GPU.
NVIDIA driver version: 470
Accelerator: GPU.
NVIDIA driver version: 535

nested_items.name: AlgorithmStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the algorithm.

nested_items.name: AlgorithmStatusDetails
nested_items.description: Details about the current status of the algorithm.

nested_items.name: ValidationStatuses
nested_items.description: The status of algorithm validation.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the algorithm for which the overall status is being reported.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status.

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: if the overall status is Failed, the reason for the failure.

nested_items.name: ImageScanStatuses
nested_items.description: The status of the scan of the algorithm's Docker image container.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the algorithm for which the overall status is being reported.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status.

nested_items.name: FailureReason
